message.content: This question requires knowledge about the effects of adding water to a pond. When gallons of water are dumped into a pond daily, the volume of water in the pond will increase. This means that the pond will grow in size. Option (A) is incorrect because adding water to the pond would prevent it from drying up. Option (C) is also incorrect because draining implies removing water from the pond, which is the opposite of what is happening in this scenario. Option (D) is incorrect because if water is being added daily, the pond would not be shrinking in size.

Option (A) is incorrect because if water is consistently added to the pond, it will not dry out. Option (C) is incorrect because drainage would imply that the water is being removed from the pond. Option (D) is incorrect because if water is consistently added, the pond will not shrink in size.
